title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.9.6-7 | 30-03-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: Om Agyana Timiran Dhasya Gyanan Janishalakaya Chakshuran Militam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
segments.summary: The lecture begins with traditional Vaishnava prayers and mantras, invoking blessings and paying respects to the spiritual master.

segments.key_quote: The meaning of these two verses, all the sages like Parvatamuni, Narada, Dhaumya, Vyasa, the Incarnation of God, Brihadashva, Bharadvaja, and Parshurama and disciples, Vasishta, Indra Pramada, Trita, Gritsamada, Asita, Kakshivan, Gautama, Atri, Kaushika, and Sudarshana were present.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the verses to be discussed and lists the names of the sages present at the assembly.

segments.key_quote: Narada Muni is inevitably associated with the narrations of the Puranas.
segments.summary: The speaker begins to explain the biographies of some of the sages mentioned in the verses, starting with Narada Muni and his role in the disciplic succession.

segments.key_quote: So, Srila Prabhupada explains that this parampara understanding is required in all places in the material creation.
segments.summary: The speaker continues discussing the importance of disciplic succession and the role of pure devotees in spreading knowledge, highlighting Narada Muni's instructions to various kings and devotees.

segments.key_quote: A great sage who practiced severe penances at Utkochaka Tirtha and was appointed royal priest to the Pandava kings.
segments.summary: The speaker shifts focus to Dhaumya Rishi, describing his role as the royal priest and advisor to the Pandavas, particularly during their exile.

segments.key_quote: Dhaumya Rishi gave Pandavas instructions how to live one year incognito and they were successful in living so.
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on Dhaumya Rishi's guidance to the Pandavas during their incognito exile and his presence at the funeral ceremony after the Kurukshetra war.

segments.key_quote: You see guidance is required from a transcendentalist.
segments.summary: The speaker explains the importance of guidance from transcendentalists for householders and the role of priests in guiding individuals according to their ashrama dharma.

segments.key_quote: Vyasadeva or Vedavyasa is a powerful incarnation of Narayana. And he broadcasts the Vedic wisdom to the world.
segments.summary: The speaker begins to describe Vyasadeva, his various names, his role as an incarnation of Narayana, and his contribution to compiling and transmitting Vedic knowledge, including the Bhagavatam.

segments.key_quote: When Vyasadeva wanted to record the great epic Mahabharata for the welfare of all people in the age of Kali, he was feeling the necessity of a powerful writer who could take up his dictation.
segments.summary: The speaker continues describing Vyasadeva's life, including his penances, the compilation of the Mahabharata with the help of Ganesha, and the birth of his three sons.
